Ad Text:
This opportunity suits an experienced Senior Business Analyst who understands the wealth management platform environment and enjoys shaping delivery outcomes across complex projects. This role sits within a leading Australian wealth management technology provider that is delivering a significant pipeline of transformation work.

You will lead analysis across discovery, planning and delivery. You will work closely with product specialists, operations teams, technology groups and external partners to define business needs and support timely project execution. You will run workshops, capture requirements, document artefacts and support change activities including impact assessments and readiness planning. You will also contribute to continuous improvement across project services and tools.

12 month fixed term contract (potential to extend)
Sydney - hybrid working
To be successful you will bring:

At least 3 years as a Business Analyst in wealth management, wrap platform exposure preferred
Strong analytical and documentation skills
Confident stakeholder engagement and facilitation capability
Experience with large-scale transformation work
Proficiency in MS Office, Jira, ConfluenceÂ 
A proactive and structured approach to problem solving
This role offers variety, responsibility and direct access to senior stakeholders in a modern platform environment. If this role is of interest, please apply.

Proud winners of the 2025 Best Learning & Development Strategy at the Australian HR Institute (AHRI) Awards, Mirvac continues to demonstrate our commitment to creating impactful learning experiences and developing future leaders.

During this exciting time, we're looking for a Senior L&D Consultant to help deliver on our strategy and shape innovative programs that build capability and unlock potential across our organisation. This is more than a traditional L&D role-you'll collaborate widely, tap into emerging trends, and design experiences that empower our people to thrive now and into the future.

What you'll do


Lead with impact: Own end-to-end delivery of high-profile L&D projects that shape the future of work at Mirvac.
Discover and design: Use data-driven insights to identify learning needs and craft tailored solutions that drive real change.
Create experiences: Develop immersive, blended learning programs-from hands-on workshops to digital-first solutions-that energise and engage.
Facilitate transformation: Deliver dynamic sessions that inspire leaders and teams to think differently and grow confidently.
Measure what matters: Implement smart evaluation tools to track outcomes, demonstrate ROI, and continuously evolve our approach.
Partner for progress: Build trusted relationships across the business to ensure learning is aligned, relevant, and future-focused.
Stay ahead: Bring fresh thinking from the L&D landscape to keep Mirvac at the cutting edge of capability development.
Coach and mentor: Support individuals on their growth journeys with meaningful guidance and career development support.
Adapt and evolve: Embrace change and take on new challenges with agility and a solutions-focused mindset.



What sets you apart


You're a strategic thinker with a passion for learning innovation. You bring:
A relevant qualification in HR, Education, Organisational Development or similar.
7+ years of experience designing and delivering impactful learning programs.
Strong project management skills and the ability to juggle multiple priorities.
Exceptional facilitation and communication skills that connect with diverse audiences.
A collaborative spirit and the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
A growth mindset and a drive for continuous improvement.

About the Business

Our client is a leading FMCG business with a long-standing reputation for delivering high-quality consumer products across Australia and New Zealand. Backed by iconic brands and a strong growth agenda, they continue to expand their presence in the retail and trade sectors. With a collaborative culture and a focus on performance, innovation and continuous improvement, this is an exciting time to join the business as they build their commercial finance capability.

Role Summary

The FP&A Manager will play a critical role in building and leading the financial planning and analysis function, working closely with the CFO and senior leaders across Sales, Marketing, Product and Supply Chain. This position is responsible for delivering timely and accurate planning, reporting and performance analysis, while acting as a key business partner to support data-driven decision making. This is a high-impact role with visibility across the executive team and a unique opportunity to shape how commercial finance supports the broader business.

Youâ€™ll be responsible for developing scalable budgeting and forecasting processes, leading variance and contribution analysis, and delivering clear, actionable insights across key revenue and cost drivers. As the business continues to scale, youâ€™ll also play a key role in identifying risks and opportunities, enhancing financial models and supporting investment decisions across new product development, pricing, margin improvement and supply chain efficiency.

Key Responsibilities
Build and lead the FP&A function across Australia and New Zealand
Manage the preparation of budgets, forecasts and long-range plans
Deliver monthly performance reporting, analysis and commentary
Drive commercial insights across pricing, product mix and margin trends
Support key business decisions across NPD, CapEx and inventory management
Partner with Sales, Product and Operations to drive profitable growth
Develop tools and models for contribution reporting and performance tracking
Monitor risks and opportunities to ensure the business remains on plan
Ensure alignment with SOX processes and financial governance standards
Provide financial insight and modelling to support strategic initiatives
Skills & Experience
CA/CPA qualified with 5â€“10 years' experience in commercial or FP&A roles
Prior experience in FMCG, consumer products or retail environments
Proven ability to develop planning models, forecast processes and decision-support tools
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights
Familiarity with systems such as Oracle, SAP or Pronto is highly desirable
Power BI or similar dashboarding/reporting experience will be highly regarded
Comfortable working across multiple functions with competing priorities
Able to influence senior stakeholders and communicate clearly with non-finance audiences
Hands-on, proactive and solutions-oriented approach.

For more information, please contact Kristian Jaksch, Director of Accounting & Finance at the Hassett Group.Â 
Â 
Kristian@hassett.com.au

Job Title: Head of Business Development & Market Intelligence
Ad Text:
The Head of Business Development & Market Intelligence is a national role working across Mapien Workplace Strategists and Mapien Law (collectively referred to as Mapien). Mapien is Australiaâ€™s most trusted specialist people consultancy and law firm offering bespoke workplace people solutions. We partner with our clients to solve their people problems using our significant experience, technical capability and multidisciplinary approach. We are the industry experts at representing our clients in all aspects of â€˜people at workâ€™ issues and have mastered the art of designing, resourcing and developing workplaces to enhance organisational performance. We have a core team of over 70 employees in four capital cities, and our specialist services are in industrial relations, workplace strategy, workplace psychology, psychological health and safety, corporate migration, employment and immigration law.

Externally recognised as a â€˜Best Workplaceâ€™ and certified â€˜Great Place to Workâ€™ through our outstanding employee feedback, Mapien understands the importance of our people and is committed to providing an exceptional employee experience by fostering a fun, professional and inclusive environment.

As we continue our significant national growth, we are looking for a self-motivated, driven Business Development expert with the capacity to drive revenue growth through strategic business development and market intelligence. This is a critical role in our national senior leadership team and will be based in our Melbourne or Sydney office. Ideally you will have significant experience in building relationships across organisations and industries to generate quality leads and revenue in our service areas.

Join our team and be part of our exciting growth journey!

Why work for us?

Our Mapien team provides the opportunity for you to work with business leaders and experts in their fields; and provides many opportunities to showcase your knowledge and expertise.

Your role can directly impact our business success.

Our people engagement score is 89%.

91% of our team say we satisfy their flexibility needs.

Our diverse team creates a fun and inclusive work environment.

We offer

A challenging and rewarding career opportunity with a recognised â€˜best workplaceâ€™ employer and accredited â€˜great place to workâ€™.

Opportunities for professional development and mentoring from our highly reputable business leaders with deep specialisation in a multitude of industries and organisations.

A competitive base salary plus revenue performance incentive.

A flexible work environment with the option for hybrid working and a collaborative workspace in our Sydney or Melbourne CBD offices.

A great team culture that values excellence, flexibility, fairness, integrity, and inclusion.

Well-being initiatives.

You will

Be a highly experienced and motivated, high performer who learns quickly and adapts easily.

Thrive on new challenges and driving business outcomes.

Value excellence, courage, and integrity.

Be a team player who doesn't mind working on your own.

Be able to travel as required.

The role

To be successful in this role you will have:

Proven track record in driving revenue growth through targeted business development strategies and new business generation.

An excellent understanding of and capability to strategically align business development activities utilising own knowledge, experience and market Intelligence to drive revenue growth in our service areas and targeted markets.

Strong analytical and research skills with the ability to translate data into actionable strategies.

Strong networking capability and ability to develop strong relationships with current Mapien clients and identify and develop business opportunities with new clients.

Ability to build and maintain networks with industry bodies, associations, and influencers to expand market presence.

Excellent, professional written and verbal communication skills.

Relevant tertiary and/or postgraduate qualifications.

8+ years in business development / client engagement / marketing or marketing intelligence ideally in professional services.

Demonstrated ability to develop internal capability in business development and mentor others.

Position Description is available upon request.

Apply today!

Please reach out to Tom Sweet, People and Performance Lead, tsweet@mapien.com.au if you have any questions.

Company description:



About Brisbane Catholic Education
Brisbane Catholic Education (BCE) is a vibrant learning community within the Archdiocese, employing over 12,000 people across a diverse range of positions. As the largest provider of Catholic education in Queensland, BCE is dedicated to delivering high-quality education from Prep to Year 12. Through strong partnerships with parents, governments, and the wider community, BCE fosters social responsibility, self-discipline and Catholic values in all its students. We offer a supportive working culture where care for the individual is an important part of our ethos. Arrive at work every day to a welcoming and compassionate environment, knowing that you'll be supported to take care of what's important to you. Learn more about Brisbane Catholic Education.



Job description:



Summary

As Senior Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving process improvement and delivering effective solutions that support strategic priorities and operational requirements. You will collaborate with stakeholders across the organisation to analyse business needs, lead projects, and provide expert advice to enhance performance and efficiency. This position requires strong analytical skills, the ability to manage complex projects, and a commitment to continuous improvement. You will be instrumental in shaping business processes, supporting IT system development, and ensuring that solutions align with organisational goals.

Work hours:â€¯Fulltime | Flexible working arrangements available

About the opportunity

Eligibility and Safeguarding requirements:â€¯

Eligibility to work in Australia for the duration of the appointment.
Positive Notice Blue Card for working with Children.
Why choose BCE

Join us and be part of the largest Catholic Diocese in Queensland, nurturing your personal and professional development goals. As a valued member of our organisation, enjoy these and other rewards:

Opportunities for career advancement and professional development
Competitive remuneration and flexible work arrangements (position dependent)

Everyone at BCE models and fosters aâ€¯commitment to the safeguarding of childrenâ€¯and promotes a culture where student protection is everyone's responsibility. The Archdiocese of Brisbane has standards of conduct for workers to maintain a safe and healthy environment for children. Our commitment to these standards requires that we conduct working with children checks and background referencing for all persons who will engage in direct and regular involvement with children and young people and/or adults-at-risk. The organisation is fully committed to child safety and has a zero tolerance to abuse of children or adults-at-risk.

Equity and inclusion are at theâ€¯core of our Catholic valuesâ€¯and we recognise the benefits of a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome candidates from all backgrounds to apply for this position.

By choosing to continue, you agree to the Privacy Policy (Employment Collection Notice which includes being contacted by Brisbane Catholic Education in future if a similar position becomes available) and to be included in BCE's talent pools for future opportunities. Show Privacy Policy

Degree qualified in mathematics, actuarial studies, statistics, or similar quantitative disciplines.

Stakeholders' management expertise

About the Role
CSK are seeking a skilled Data Engineer to design, build, and optimize data solutions that power analytics, machine learning, and business intelligence. This role involves working with real-time and batch data pipelines, large-scale data warehouses, and modern data streaming technologies to ensure reliable, secure, and scalable data flows across the organisation.
Â 
Responsibilities

Design and implement real-time data streaming solutions for efficient processing.
Develop and maintain robust data pipelines for batch and streaming workflows, including ETL processes.
Create and manage large-scale data warehouses to support analytics and reporting needs.
Build certified datasets by integrating diverse data sources to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and stakeholders to deliver effective data solutions.
Optimize workflows, monitor pipelines, and troubleshoot issues to maintain high performance.
Ensure data security and compliance with industry standards and regulations.
Stay current with advancements in data engineering, data science, and machine learning.
Write efficient, well-documented code with unit tests and clear documentation.
Lead solution design, development, testing, and monitoring for production-ready data platforms.
Â 
Skills Required
Â 

5+ years of experience in software engineering, data engineering, or database management.
Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts (dimensional modelling, star schema).
Experience with ETL processes and cloud-based tools.
Familiarity with SQL and NoSQL databases and modern lakehouse technologies (Apache Iceberg, Delta Lake, Apache Trino).
Experience with data streaming technologies (Apache Kafka, AWS Kinesis, Apache Flink, Apache Spark).
Demonstrated expertise in data pipelines, orchestration tools, and datamart creation.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
Intellectual curiosity and adaptability in dynamic environments.
Ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Â 
Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
Experience with DevSecOps standards, source control systems, and tools (Jenkins, GitHub).
Prior experience with data engineering tools and architectures.
Industry experience in transportation, logistics, supply chain, or high-tech sectors.
Experience working in Agile environments (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe).
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms.
Familiarity with open-source technologies and tools.
Knowledge of geospatial data transformation and spatial libraries.
To be eligible to apply, you must be an Australian / New Zealand citizen or hold permanent residency status in Australia. Please only apply if you meet the above skills and experiences. Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the advert.

Job Title: Manager, Digital Agriculture and Artificial Intelligence
Ad Text:
GRDC

As one of the world's leading grains research organisations, the Grains Research and Development Corporation (GRDC) plays an integral role in driving research outcomes and innovations that directly benefit Australia's grain industry. GRDC's purpose is to invest in research, development and extension (RD&E) to create enduring profitability for Australian grain growers. Â 

We are seeking a Manager, Digital Agriculture and Artificial Intelligence based in Adelaide.

GRDC is happy to review applications from alternate locations on a case-by-case basis, noting that Adelaide and Canberra are preferred.

Role

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Enabling Technologies, you will lead the identification, development, and management of R&D investments that apply digital agronomy, precision agriculture, and AI-driven solutions to the grains sector. Youâ€™ll work across a diverse portfolioâ€”from remote sensing and on-farm automation to data-driven crop managementâ€”ensuring projects deliver real value to Australian grain growers.

Key responsibilities

Developing and managing high-impact R&D proposals and investments.

Providing technical leadership across GRDCâ€™s broader portfolio, including genetics, crop protection, and farming systems.

Building and maintaining strong networks with industry, research, and commercial partners.

Supporting commercialisation and adoption pathways for innovative technologies.

About you

The ideal candidate will have:

5+ years of experience in digital agriculture, ag-tech, data science, or agronomy.

Proven ability to develop business cases and manage complex R&D projects.

Strong negotiation, facilitation, and stakeholder engagement skills.

A passion for innovation and a track record of delivering results in a collaborative environment.

Mandatory Requirements

Valid Australian Driverâ€™s Licence.

Willingness to travel as required.

What we offer:

We know that great work happens when our people feel supported. Here's how we make that happen:

Hybrid Working Model â€“ We offer a true 50/50 hybrid approach. Collaborate in person and balance it with focused work-from-home days.

Wellness Support â€“ Access an annual wellness fund to support your physical, mental, or emotional wellbeing.

Set Up for Success â€“ Support to set up your remote workspace comfortably and effectively.

Extra Time Off â€“ Enjoy a paid shutdown between Christmas and New Year.

Supportive Parental Leave â€“ Paid parental leave for both mums and dads (following a qualifying period).

A Supportive Team Culture â€“ Be part of a capable, collaborative team that values trust, initiative, and shared success.

For more information about working with GRDC, please visitÂ https://grdc.com.au/about/careersÂ 

For more information about the role, please contact recruitment@grdc.com.au

Closing date: 30 January 2026

GRDC is committed to supporting an inclusive and diverse workforce and welcomes and encourages applications from People with Disability (PwD), First Nations peoples, LGBTIQA+ people, people from Culturally and Linguistically Diverse (CALD) backgrounds, mature age and young workers. GRDC will provide reasonable adjustments for candidates to participate equitably in the recruitment process and discuss workplace adjustments to fulfil the inherent requirements of the role.

Ad Text:
Multiple opportunities | Varied portfolio of projects
Be challenged. Make an impact. Imagine with us.
Onsite Roles with flexible work arrangements

Are you an experienced and adaptable Business Analyst looking to broaden your impact? The Digital Technology Solutions (DTS) team at the University of Newcastle is seeking multiple Business Analysts to support a diverse range of projects and delivery streams across the University.

The role

We are recruiting for several Business Analyst positions to work across a variety of initiatives and delivery streams within DTS. These roles offer the opportunity to contribute to complex, meaningful initiatives and services that enhance the experience of students, staff, and the broader University community. As a Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and digital solutions, supporting the full lifecycle of business and system improvement initiativesâ€”from discovery and requirements definition through to solution design, testing, implementation, and post-delivery optimisation.

You will work closely with stakeholders, end-users, and delivery teams to analyse requirements, optimise processes, and contribute to the successful delivery of user-centred solutions in a dynamic higher education environment.

What youâ€™ll do:

Engage with stakeholders through workshops, interviews, and consultations to understand business needs and document clear, fit-for-purpose requirements
Translate business requirements into functional and non-functional specifications that guide solution design and delivery
Collaborate with technical and delivery teams to design and validate solutions aligned with enterprise standards and organisational objectives
Analyse current processes and systems, identify gaps, and recommend improvements that deliver measurable business value
Support solution testing activities, including test case development and user acceptance testing coordination
Contribute to project planning, estimation, scheduling, and governance activities
Maintain high-quality documentation such as process maps, user stories, system specifications, and change artefacts
Support implementation and post-go-live activities, including issue resolution, benefits realisation, and continuous improvement
Build strong relationships across business and technical teams to ensure shared understanding and effective communication

These full-time positions are fixed term for up to 2 years andÂ locatedÂ onsite at Callaghan Campus.Â 

About you
You are a proactive and consultative Business Analyst who enjoys working across varied initiatives and stakeholder groups. You bring:
Proven experience in business analysis within digital, systems, or process improvement environments
Strong stakeholder engagement and facilitation skills, with the ability to translate complex needs into clear outcomes
Experience working within project or delivery frameworks, including agile, hybrid, or waterfall methodologies
A user-centred mindset with a focus on improving experience and service outcomes
Strong analytical, documentation, and communication skills
The ability to adapt quickly and work effectively across multiple projects and priorities
Experience in higher education, large complex organisations, or regulated environments will be highly regarded, but is not essential.

Our vision is to be a world-leading University for our regions and creating a better future for our regions and the globe.
